Information:","position":2,"area":"General"},{"type":"GeneralText","content":"

The community college statistics course included on this agreement has been approved as a substitute for Statistics 12 or 13 which means it may not transfer as an exact UCLA equivalent.

","position":3,"area":"General"},{"type":"GeneralText","content":"

The Data Theory major joins the strength of the university's Mathematics department with the innovation of its Statistics department to offer students a world-class education in the foundations of Data Science. This major focuses on the fundamental concepts needed to model data and to make sense of data.


Listed below are the lower division preparation courses for the major. Transfer applicants to the Data Theory major are admitted to the pre-major and must petition to enter the major no later than the Spring Quarter of their year at UCLA.


To be considered for this major, you must complete the following courses by the end if spring before transfer:

  • One and a half years of Calculus through Multivariable,
  • Either Linear Algebra or Differential Equations, and
  • One Introductory Statistics course.

Completion of the full calculus series (encompassing single variable, multivariable, linear algebra and differential equations) and One introductory course in C++ is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED.

All courses must be taken for a letter grade.


For more information regarding this major and UCLA's transfer selection process, visit: https://www.math.ucla.edu and https://admission.ucla.edu.


PLEASE NOTE: the community college courses listed below have been approved to satisfy the preparation requirements for this major at UCLA, but they may not be exact equivalents of the UCLA courses listed.

","position":1,"area":"General"},{"type":"RequirementTitle","content":"LOWER DIVISION MAJOR REQUIREMENTS","position":0,"area":"Requirements"},{"type":"GeneralTitle","content":"IMPORTANT MAJOR INFORMATION","position":0,"area":"General"}]
